Enums/PatternParsingError.html#/s:11Hyph.name: deficientPattern(_:)
Enums/PatternParsingError.html#/s:11Hyph.abstract: A pattern string which did not contain at least one letter and one digit from between 1 and 9, inclusive.

Enums/PatternParsingError.html#/s:11Hyph.name: invalidCharacter(_:)
Enums/PatternParsingError.html#/s:11Hyph.abstract: A pattern string which contained a character that was not alphabetic, a digit 1-9, or a period.

Enums/PatternParsingError.html#/s:11Hyph.name: consecutiveDigits(_:)
Enums/PatternParsingError.html#/s:11Hyph.abstract: A pattern string which contained multiple consecutive digits.

Enums/PatternParsingError.html.name: PatternParsingError
Enums/PatternParsingError.html.abstract: An error that can be thrown when constructing a Pattern instance.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: minLength
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: The minimum character count for a word to be hyphenated.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: minLeading
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: The minimum number of characters between the beginning of the word and a hyphenation point.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: minTrailing
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: The minimum number of characters between the end of the word and a hyphenation point.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: separator
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: The character to insert at each hyphenation point.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: init()
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: Creates a Hyphenator instance using the default English patterns and exceptions.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: init(patterns:exceptions:)
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: Creates a Hyphenator instance using the patterns and exceptions contained in strings.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: init(patternFile:exceptionFile:)
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: Creates a Hyphenator instance using the patterns and exceptions contained in files.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: copy()
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: Returns a new Hyphenator instance, copied from an existing instance.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: hyphenate(text:)
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: Returns a new String formed by finding hyphenation points in the input text and

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: unhyphenate(text:)
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: Returns a new String formed by removing the separator character from the input text.

Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.name: removeAllCustomExceptions()
Classes/Hyphenator.html#/s:11Hyphenation.abstract: Removes all custom exceptions that have been added to the Hyphenator using addCustomExceptions(_:).

Classes/Hyphenator.html.name: Hyphenator
Classes/Hyphenator.html.abstract: An object that hyphenates text using the Knuth-Liang algorithm.
